MainBanner.title2:

MainBanner.description2: From classic to modern, our curated natural stone collection brings unique beauty and durability to every design. Explore our catalog and find the perfect match for your vision.

HomeMainSection.text: Majen is a leading travertine supplier from Turkey, offering premium blocks, slabs, tiles, and custom designs directly from our Uşak–Ulubey quarry. With decades of expertise, we export wholesale travertine to the USA, Europe, and the Middle East. Our quarry-direct sourcing ensures consistent A-grade quality, competitive <fob>FOB</fob>/<cif>CIF</cif> pricing, and sustainable production methods. By choosing Majen, importers and wholesalers gain a reliable partner committed to delivering wholesale travertine from Turkey with transparency, strong logistics support, and on-time delivery.

LogisticSection.text: Majen specializes in the export of wholesale travertine from Turkey. We provide <fob>FOB</fob> (Free On Board) shipping, where we load containers at Turkish ports, and <cif>CIF</cif> (Cost, Insurance & Freight), where we handle transportation to your destination port. Our export team prepares full documentation including commercial invoices, packing lists, certificates of origin, and inspection reports. Each block, slab, and tile is packaged with reinforced wooden frames, nylon wrapping, and metal strapping to minimize risk during sea freight. Our proven logistics network ensures safe and timely delivery of wholesale travertine worldwide Majen is recognized as a trusted Travertine Supplier from Turkey.

InfoSection.subtitle: PRODUCT GROUPS
InfoSection.heading: Wholesale Travertine Blocks, Slabs & Tiles
InfoSection.description: Our product portfolio covers the full spectrum of wholesale travertine blocks, slabs, and tiles. Blocks average 280×220×200 cm, weighing 30–35 tons, reinforced for international shipping. Slabs are available in 2 cm, 3 cm, and 5 cm thicknesses with finishes such as polished, honed, brushed, or tumbled. Travertine tiles come in popular formats like 30×60 and 60×60 cm, ideal for bathrooms, kitchens, pools, and outdoor spaces. Majen offers Blaundos Antiko, Blaundos Light, and Blaundos Ivory colors, ensuring diverse options for every project that requires wholesale travertine from Turkey.

product1.title: Travertine Blocks
product1.description: Large-size blocks selected at the quarry with consistent texture and color; ideal yield for fabrication and high-volume projects.

product2.title: Travertine Slabs
product2.description: 2, 3, 5 cm thicknesses with polished, honed or brushed finishes; calibrated, reinforced, and ideal for bookmatch use.

product3.title: Travertine Tiles
product3.description: Standard sizes such as 30×60, 60×60, 60×120; precise edges for fast, clean installation in interior and exterior spaces.

product4.title: Travertine Special Designs
product4.description: Custom waterjet cuts, mosaic combinations, CNC carving and 3D panels; tailored to project details and delivered turnkey.

CollectionsSection.text: Blaundos Antiko: Grey-beige antique tones for luxury façades. Blaundos Light: Light beige for modern interiors and exteriors. Blaundos Ivory: Ivory-cream for hotels, villas, and public spaces. Available finishes include polished, honed, brushed, and tumbled. Custom surface treatments are available upon request, giving architects and wholesalers flexibility for diverse project requirements. Natural stones supplied by Majen – your reliable Travertine Supplier from Turkey.

export1.title: <fob>FOB</fob> (Free on Board) – Travertine Exports
export1.description: With <fob>FOB</fob>, Majen loads the containers at Turkish ports, and buyers manage the shipping from there. This method is widely used for bulk orders of travertine blocks and slabs.

export2.title: <cif>CIF</cif> (Cost, Insurance & Freight) – Hassle-Free Shipping
export2.description: With <cif>CIF</cif>, Majen handles shipping, insurance, and freight to the buyer’s destination port. Importers prefer this for convenience when sourcing wholesale travertine from Turkey.

export3.title: <exw>EXW</exw> (Ex Works) – Flexible Factory Pickup
export3.description: Buyers can arrange their own logistics directly from our quarry or warehouse. This option is suitable for importers with established freight partners.

export4.title: Export Documentation
export4.description: Majen provides all necessary export documents for customs clearance and smooth logistics: Commercial invoice & packing list Certificate of origin Quality certificates & inspection reports Customs clearance documents

export5.title: Packaging & Container Loading
export5.description: Travertine blocks, slabs, and tiles are reinforced with wooden supports, nylon wrapping, and metal strapping. Safe container loading minimizes breakage during sea freight.

item1.title: Blaundos Antico Travertine – Warm Tones, Natural Veining
item1.description: Quarry-selected Antico travertine from Uşak–Ulubey, ideal for blocks, slabs (2–3–5 cm), and tiles. Perfect for hotel lobbies, villas, and façades with warm beige-brown hues and expressive veins.

item2.title: Blaundos Light Travertine – Bright, Minimal Textures
item2.description: Light travertine offers light beige color and subtle veining—a clean, modern look for interiors and exteriors. Great for large areas requiring consistent tone.

item3.title: Blaundos Ivory Travertine – Elegant Cream Palette
item3.description: Ivory travertine features a creamy palette and balanced veining—ideal for countertops, wall cladding, wet areas, and bookmatched designs.

blocks.title: Wholesale Travertine Blocks
blocks.intro: Majen is a trusted supplier of Wholesale Travertine Blocks , offering premium quality in Blaundos Antiko, Light, and Ivory varieties. Extracted from our Uşak–Ulubey quarry, blocks average 280×220×200 cm and weigh 30–35 tons. With reinforced packaging and container-ready preparation, these blocks are export-ready for factories and wholesalers worldwide. Importers rely on Majen’s quarry-direct supply, consistent quality, and reliable FOB/CIF shipping options for long-term projects.
blocks.intro2: Our Wholesale Travertine Blocks are preferred by global importers for durability, size, and versatility. Direct quarry sourcing ensures uniform texture and A-grade quality, while certified inspections guarantee reliability. Whether destined for slab cutting, tile processing, or custom designs, Majen provides stable supply with transparent logistics. Architects and wholesalers trust our blocks to meet international standards, combining natural beauty with cost-effective production.
description: High durability, natural beauty, and quarry-direct sourcing from Uşak–Ulubey make Majen blocks a trusted choice. Our travertine blocks provide consistent texture, A-grade quality, and secure packaging for reliable international supply.

Travertine blocks are primarily used for factory processing into slabs and tiles, bulk export distribution, and large-scale architectural projects. Offered in Blaundos Antiko, Light, and Ivory, our blocks meet the diverse needs of global importers and construction firms.

Standard block size is approx. 280×220×200 cm, with natural quarry faces and an average weight of 30–35 tons. Bulk orders are export-ready and reinforced for container loading, ensuring safe handling during international shipments.

Blocks are supplied with natural/raw surfaces (wire-cut) straight from the quarry. For export, reinforced wooden frames, nylon wrapping, and metal strapping are applied, minimizing risk and ensuring that travertine blocks arrive safely worldwide.

variants.heading: Travertine Block Varieties
variants.text: We supply three exclusive varieties of Wholesale Travertine Blocks: Blaundos Antiko (grey-beige antique tones), Blaundos Light (light beige), and Blaundos Ivory (ivory-cream). These blocks are primarily delivered with natural quarry surfaces, ready for slab cutting or custom processing. Each variety provides distinct tones for luxury façades, interiors, or large-scale commercial projects. With flexible finishes available upon request, Majen ensures adaptability for diverse architectural needs.

TextSection.text1: Majen ensures a seamless export process for travertine blocks, from quarry extraction to international delivery. Each block is inspected, reinforced, and documented with commercial invoices, packing lists, and certificates of origin. With FOB and CIF shipping terms, buyers worldwide can rely on a transparent, efficient, and secure supply chain for their travertine block orders.
TextSection.text2: Every travertine block is carefully graded to meet international standards. Factors such as color consistency, surface quality, and block integrity are checked before shipment. Majen’s strict quality control guarantees that only top-grade travertine blocks are exported, reducing waste during processing and ensuring predictable results for large-scale projects.
TextSection.text3: Travertine blocks are in high demand across markets in Europe, the USA, and the Middle East. These blocks are widely used for factory processing into slabs and tiles, as well as landmark architectural projects requiring natural stone. Majen’s consistent block supply makes us a preferred partner for importers, wholesalers, and construction companies worldwide.
TextSection.header4: Why Partner with Majen for Travertine Blocks?
TextSection.text4: Majen is more than a quarry – we are an experienced export partner for international buyers. By sourcing directly from Uşak–Ulubey, importers benefit from stable production, competitive pricing, and responsive customer support. With reinforced packaging, reliable documentation, and long-term relationships, Majen is trusted by global buyers of travertine blocks.
TextSection.subtext1: Average block size is 280×220×200 cm with natural surfaces. Export-ready, suitable for bulk orders, with reinforced packaging for container loading.
TextSection.subtext2: Countertops, wall cladding, flooring, and exterior façades where durability and natural elegance are required.
TextSection.subtext3: Polished, honed, tumbled, and brushed surfaces to match diverse design requirements and performance needs.
TextSection.subtext4: Custom designs elevate aesthetics and provide exclusive solutions while preserving travertine’s natural durability and texture.

QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq1_header: What sizes are available for travertine blocks?
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq1_text: Standard block size is approx. 280×220×200 cm, weighing 30–35 tons. These travertine blocks are export-ready and reinforced for container loading.
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq2_header: Which travertine block colors do you supply?
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq2_text: We supply Blaundos Antiko, Blaundos Light, and Blaundos Ivory travertine blocks, each offering unique tones and consistent A-grade quality for export.
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq3_header: How are travertine blocks packaged for shipping?
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq3_text: Travertine blocks are reinforced with wooden frames, nylon wrapping, and metal strapping to minimize movement and damage during sea freight.
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq4_header: Do you export travertine blocks worldwide?
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq4_text: Yes. Majen exports travertine blocks globally with FOB and CIF terms, providing full documentation including invoices, packing lists, and certificates of origin.
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq5_header: Why choose Majen for travertine blocks?
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq5_text: Majen is a quarry-direct supplier of travertine blocks from Uşak–Ulubey, trusted by global importers for reliable supply, strict quality control, and competitive pricing.

antiko.title: Wholesale Travertine Blocks Blaundos Antico
antiko.intro: Blaundos Antico travertine is a warm, beige-toned stone with antique character and subtle movement that suits both classic and contemporary designs. Sourced directly from our Uşak–Ulubey region, Majen supplies wholesale slabs with consistent grading, reliable lead times, and reinforced packaging for export. Architects, importers, and contractors choose this variety for durable floors, façades, countertops, and bespoke interior features, achieving timeless elegance with dependable performance across residential and commercial projects.
antiko.alt: Wholesale Blaundos Antiko travertine blocks from Turkey
antiko.title2: Why Choose Blaundos Antico Travertine Blocks?
antiko.intro2: Blaundos Antico stands out for its earthy palette, nuanced veining, and antique texture that adds depth without overpowering a space. Its density and calibrated finishes support heavy-traffic areas while remaining easy to maintain. With quarry-direct sourcing, Majen controls selection and grading, ensuring predictable results at scale. Competitive pricing, flexible MOQs, and project-matched lots help streamline specifications. For large orders, we provide sample boards and detailed QC reports, enabling confident decisions for global builds.
description: Why choose Blaundos Antiko slabs: antique-inspired look, expressive veining, bookmatch options and strong continuity on large surfaces. Excellent balance of authenticity and durability for premium interiors.

Sourced and processed in Uşak–Ulubey. Used in island countertops, bathroom vanities, reception desks, wall cladding, elevator surrounds and luxury retail fixtures. Shade-verified lots for consistent project outcomes.

cards.text1: From luxury hospitality to private villas, Blaundos Antico adapts to varied aesthetics. Its neutral warmth pairs well with wood, metal, and glass, allowing cohesive palettes in mixed-material schemes. Designers value its ability to soften minimal interiors or enrich traditional settings with organic texture. Available finishes expand possibilities, from refined polished looks to tactile brushed or tumbled surfaces ideal for outdoor paths and pool surrounds. The result is a reliable, elegant stone that elevates spaces without visual noise.
cards.text2: Calibrated thickness, consistent flatness, and suitable surface treatments help Blaundos Antico perform in lobbies, corridors, and retail zones. Anti-slip options support safety outdoors, while proper sealing enhances stain resistance indoors. With accurate cutting and tight tolerances, installers achieve clean joints and level surfaces, reducing rework and time on site. This blend of aesthetics and practicality positions Blaundos Antico as a proven specification for demanding, design-driven environments across climates and usage patterns.

ApplicationSection.title: Applications of Blaundos Antico Travertine Slabs
ApplicationSection.text: Blaundos Antico is specified for floors, wall cladding, countertops, fireplace surrounds, stair treads, and exterior façades. Its antique texture lends character to boutique hotels and residences, while honed or polished finishes suit refined interiors. Outdoors, brushed or tumbled slabs complement landscaping, garden paths, and pool decks. The stone’s tonal stability supports continuity between inside and outside, helping designers create cohesive transitions. With accurate sizing and reliable supply, it scales from small renovations to flagship builds.
ApplicationSection.subtitle: Interior & Exterior Use Cases
ApplicationSection.subtext: Indoors, Blaundos Antico brings warmth to living areas and statement value to feature walls or reception desks. In kitchens and baths, sealed surfaces provide practical durability with natural beauty. Externally, its weathered look enriches patios and façades, aging gracefully over time. For public spaces, coordinated formats (slabs, tiles, custom pieces) keep design language consistent. Majen’s technical support advises on finish selection, slip ratings, and maintenance to match climate, footfall, and performance requirements.

AvailableSection.title: Available Sizes & Thickness
AvailableSection.text: Majen supplies slabs commonly at 2 cm and 3 cm thickness, cut from blocks selected for tone and structure. Custom dimensions can be produced on request, including book-matched sets for feature walls. Tight calibration and precision polishing ensure flatness and clean edges that speed installation. For special elements—vanities, stair treads, or oversized cladding—our team provides cut-to-size options that maintain vein continuity. Consistent sizing across batches supports predictable waste rates and accurate take-offs.
AvailableSection.subtitle: Dimensional Tolerances
AvailableSection.subtext: Slab thickness is controlled within industry tolerances to support even load distribution and dependable adhesion. Surface regularity reduces lippage risk on large floors, while square edges and stable geometry help installers achieve fine joints in visual-critical areas. For ventilated façades and lightweight assemblies, we coordinate with fabricators to meet bracket and anchor constraints. All dimensions are verified at dispatch, and reports are available for documentation and submittal packages when required.

FinishesSection.title: Finishes & Packaging Options
FinishesSection.text: Blaundos Antico can be supplied polished, honed, brushed, or tumbled to align with design intent and slip resistance needs. Finishes are applied with calibrated equipment to keep tone and sheen consistent across lots. For export, slabs are packed in reinforced wooden bundles with corner guards, interleaves, and strapping that limits movement in transit. Moisture-resistant wrapping and clear labeling aid handling at ports and job sites. Packaging is optimized for container loading to minimize risk and freight costs.
FinishesSection.subtitle: Surface Finish Guidance
FinishesSection.subtext: Select polished for premium interiors, honed for low-glare sophistication, brushed where texture is desired, and tumbled for rustic, outdoor-ready charm. In wet areas or exterior paths, combine texture with appropriate sealers to improve maintenance and slip performance. We can supply matched samples across finishes so teams preview appearance under project lighting. This process helps align expectations early, reducing change orders and helping stakeholders approve materials quickly and confidently.
FinishesSection.subtext2: Each bundle is photographed and measured prior to loading. Straps, braces, and internal blocking limit vibration, while protective interlayers reduce abrasion. Bundle IDs map to packing lists for fast checks at customs and on site. Shock indicators can be added on request. The goal is simple: slabs arrive installation-ready, with documentation that keeps receiving and quality verification efficient for importers and contractors.

PartnerSection.title: Why Partner with Majen for Travertine Slabs?
PartnerSection.description: Beyond quarry access, Majen offers technical guidance, flexible MOQs, and dependable lead times that fit real-world schedules. Direct sourcing keeps costs predictable and ensures tone matching across lots. Reinforced packaging, thorough documentation, and responsive support reduce friction during shipping and receiving. We build long-term relationships with importers, distributors, and contractors, providing post-delivery assistance and repeatable quality so projects finish on brief, on budget, and on time.
PartnerSection.text1: From sampling and mock-ups to installation advice, our team responds quickly with practical guidance. Multilingual communication, transparent timelines, and after-sales follow-up help keep stakeholders aligned. Whether you need book-matched features, custom cuts, or coordinated tiles, we manage details and share progress so decisions stay informed.
PartnerSection.text2: We prioritize responsible quarrying, water recycling, and waste reduction. Material traceability and documentation support green building goals and client ESG policies. These practices contribute to durable, long-life installations with lower lifecycle impact.
PartnerSection.text3: We provide packing data, certificates of origin, and HS codes; optional lab tests and slip ratings can be arranged. This documentation simplifies import processes and supports submittals for architects and contractors, helping approvals proceed without delays.

TextSection.text1: Explore complementary selections that pair well with Blaundos Antico. Each variety offers distinct tone and movement for different design intents, enabling cohesive palettes across floors, walls, and façades. Discover Blaundos Light Slabs for brighter schemes and Blaundos Ivory Slabs for creamy warmth. Coordinate with Travertine Tiles or Travertine Blocks to extend the language of natural stone through interiors, exteriors, and custom elements while keeping sourcing streamlined under one partner.
TextSection.text2: Ideal for kitchen islands, vanities and lobby walls. Pair with vein-cut bookmatch for dramatic continuity; specify 20–30 mm for interiors, 30+ mm for high-stress zones.
TextSection.text3: Reinforced A-frames, corner and moisture protection, photo-documented loading and shared seal numbers. FOB İzmir or CIF to major ports.

light.title: Blaundos Light Travertine Blocks

light.alt: Wholesale Blaundos Light travertine slabs from Turkey

Favored for counters, wall cladding and reception desks; consistent lots for large areas.

cards.text1: From luxury hospitality to private villas, Blaundos Antico adapts to varied aesthetics. Its neutral warmth pairs well with wood, metal, and glass, allowing cohesive palettes in mixed-material schemes. Designers value its ability to soften minimal interiors or enrich traditional settings with organic texture. Available finishes expand possibilities, from refined polished looks to tactile brushed or tumbled surfaces ideal for outdoor paths and pool surrounds. The result is a reliable, elegant stone that elevates spaces without visual noise.
cards.text2: Calibrated thickness, consistent flatness, and suitable surface treatments help Blaundos Antico perform in lobbies, corridors, and retail zones. Anti-slip options support safety outdoors, while proper sealing enhances stain resistance indoors. With accurate cutting and tight tolerances, installers achieve clean joints and level surfaces, reducing rework and time on site. This blend of aesthetics and practicality positions Blaundos Antico as a proven specification for demanding, design-driven environments across climates and usage patterns.

ApplicationSection.title: Applications of Blaundos Antico Travertine Slabs
ApplicationSection.text: Blaundos Antico is specified for floors, wall cladding, countertops, fireplace surrounds, stair treads, and exterior façades. Its antique texture lends character to boutique hotels and residences, while honed or polished finishes suit refined interiors. Outdoors, brushed or tumbled slabs complement landscaping, garden paths, and pool decks. The stone’s tonal stability supports continuity between inside and outside, helping designers create cohesive transitions. With accurate sizing and reliable supply, it scales from small renovations to flagship builds.
ApplicationSection.subtitle: Interior & Exterior Use Cases
ApplicationSection.subtext: Indoors, Blaundos Antico brings warmth to living areas and statement value to feature walls or reception desks. In kitchens and baths, sealed surfaces provide practical durability with natural beauty. Externally, its weathered look enriches patios and façades, aging gracefully over time. For public spaces, coordinated formats (slabs, tiles, custom pieces) keep design language consistent. Majen’s technical support advises on finish selection, slip ratings, and maintenance to match climate, footfall, and performance requirements.

AvailableSection.title: Available Sizes & Thickness
AvailableSection.text: Majen supplies slabs commonly at 2 cm and 3 cm thickness, cut from blocks selected for tone and structure. Custom dimensions can be produced on request, including book-matched sets for feature walls. Tight calibration and precision polishing ensure flatness and clean edges that speed installation. For special elements—vanities, stair treads, or oversized cladding—our team provides cut-to-size options that maintain vein continuity. Consistent sizing across batches supports predictable waste rates and accurate take-offs.
AvailableSection.subtitle: Dimensional Tolerances
AvailableSection.subtext: Slab thickness is controlled within industry tolerances to support even load distribution and dependable adhesion. Surface regularity reduces lippage risk on large floors, while square edges and stable geometry help installers achieve fine joints in visual-critical areas. For ventilated façades and lightweight assemblies, we coordinate with fabricators to meet bracket and anchor constraints. All dimensions are verified at dispatch, and reports are available for documentation and submittal packages when required.

FinishesSection.title: Finishes & Packaging Options
FinishesSection.text: Blaundos Antico can be supplied polished, honed, brushed, or tumbled to align with design intent and slip resistance needs. Finishes are applied with calibrated equipment to keep tone and sheen consistent across lots. For export, slabs are packed in reinforced wooden bundles with corner guards, interleaves, and strapping that limits movement in transit. Moisture-resistant wrapping and clear labeling aid handling at ports and job sites. Packaging is optimized for container loading to minimize risk and freight costs.
FinishesSection.subtitle: Surface Finish Guidance
FinishesSection.subtext: Select polished for premium interiors, honed for low-glare sophistication, brushed where texture is desired, and tumbled for rustic, outdoor-ready charm. In wet areas or exterior paths, combine texture with appropriate sealers to improve maintenance and slip performance. We can supply matched samples across finishes so teams preview appearance under project lighting. This process helps align expectations early, reducing change orders and helping stakeholders approve materials quickly and confidently.
FinishesSection.subtext2: Each bundle is photographed and measured prior to loading. Straps, braces, and internal blocking limit vibration, while protective interlayers reduce abrasion. Bundle IDs map to packing lists for fast checks at customs and on site. Shock indicators can be added on request. The goal is simple: slabs arrive installation-ready, with documentation that keeps receiving and quality verification efficient for importers and contractors.

PartnerSection.title: Why Partner with Majen for Travertine Slabs?
PartnerSection.description: Beyond quarry access, Majen offers technical guidance, flexible MOQs, and dependable lead times that fit real-world schedules. Direct sourcing keeps costs predictable and ensures tone matching across lots. Reinforced packaging, thorough documentation, and responsive support reduce friction during shipping and receiving. We build long-term relationships with importers, distributors, and contractors, providing post-delivery assistance and repeatable quality so projects finish on brief, on budget, and on time.
PartnerSection.text1: From sampling and mock-ups to installation advice, our team responds quickly with practical guidance. Multilingual communication, transparent timelines, and after-sales follow-up help keep stakeholders aligned. Whether you need book-matched features, custom cuts, or coordinated tiles, we manage details and share progress so decisions stay informed.
PartnerSection.text2: We prioritize responsible quarrying, water recycling, and waste reduction. Material traceability and documentation support green building goals and client ESG policies. These practices contribute to durable, long-life installations with lower lifecycle impact.
PartnerSection.text3: We provide packing data, certificates of origin, and HS codes; optional lab tests and slip ratings can be arranged. This documentation simplifies import processes and supports submittals for architects and contractors, helping approvals proceed without delays.

slabs.title: Wholesale Travertine Slabs | Majen
slabs.intro: Majen is a leading exporter of Wholesale Travertine Slabs , supplying 2cm, 3cm, and 5cm slabs directly from our Uşak–Ulubey quarry. Available in Blaundos Antiko, Light, and Ivory, our travertine slabs are crafted for consistency, durability, and natural elegance. Each slab is carefully cut and inspected to meet A-grade standards, reinforced for international shipment, and trusted by architects and wholesalers worldwide.
slabs.intro2: Turkey is the world’s largest supplier of travertine, and Majen delivers premium selections. Our Wholesale Travertine Slabs offer polished, honed, brushed, and tumbled finishes to suit diverse projects. Quarry-direct sourcing ensures consistent supply and competitive pricing. Importers and designers rely on Majen slabs for residential, commercial, and hospitality projects requiring both strength and timeless beauty.

description: High durability, quarry-direct sourcing from Uşak–Ulubey, and precise cutting deliver consistent A-grade travertine slabs. Reliable lead times and reinforced packing make Majen a trusted partner for global projects.

Travertine slabs are used for countertops, wall cladding, interior floors and exterior façades in residential, hospitality and commercial developments. Blaundos Antiko, Light and Ivory offer distinct tones for different design intents.
Standard production in 2 cm, 3 cm and 5 cm thickness. Common sizes include large formats suitable for efficient fabrication, reducing waste and ensuring predictable results at scale.
Available finishes: polished, honed, brushed, tumbled. Slabs are packed in reinforced wooden crates, strapped and wrapped for safe container loading and long-distance sea freight.

variants.heading: Travertine Slab Varieties
variants.text: Majen offers three main types of Wholesale Travertine Slabs From Turkey: Blaundos Antiko, Blaundos Light and Blaundos Ivory. Each selection is cut from our Uşak–Ulubey quarry for consistent texture, durability and natural elegance, and is export-ready with reinforced packaging for secure international shipments.

TextSection.text1: Majen ensures a seamless export process for travertine slabs, from precise quarry cutting to international delivery. Each slab is inspected, reinforced, and documented with commercial invoices, packing lists, and certificates of origin. With FOB and CIF shipping terms, buyers worldwide can rely on a transparent, efficient, and secure supply chain for their travertine slab orders.
TextSection.text2: Every travertine slab is carefully graded to meet international standards. Factors such as thickness accuracy, surface finish, and color consistency are checked before shipment. Majen’s strict quality control guarantees that only A-grade travertine slabs are exported, reducing waste during installation and ensuring predictable results for projects of all scales.
TextSection.text3: Travertine slabs are in high demand across markets in Europe, the USA, and the Middle East. These slabs are widely used for countertops, wall cladding, flooring, and exterior façades in residential, commercial, and hospitality projects. Majen’s consistent slab supply makes us a preferred partner for importers, wholesalers, and construction firms worldwide.
TextSection.header4: Why Partner with Majen for Travertine Slabs?
TextSection.text4: Majen is more than a quarry – we are an experienced export partner for international buyers. By sourcing directly from Uşak–Ulubey, importers benefit from stable production, competitive pricing, and responsive customer support. With reinforced packaging, reliable documentation, and long-term relationships, Majen is trusted by global buyers of travertine slabs.
TextSection.subtext1: Average block size is 280×220×200 cm with natural surfaces. Export-ready, suitable for bulk orders, with reinforced packaging for container loading.
TextSection.subtext2: Countertops, wall cladding, flooring, and exterior façades where durability and natural elegance are required.
TextSection.subtext3: Polished, honed, tumbled, and brushed surfaces to match diverse design requirements and performance needs.
TextSection.subtext4: Custom designs elevate aesthetics and provide exclusive solutions while preserving travertine’s natural durability and texture.

QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq1_header: What thicknesses are available for travertine slabs?
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq1_text: Travertine slabs are produced in 2cm, 3cm, and 5cm thickness, with custom sizes available on request.

antiko.title: Wholesale Travertine Slabs Blaundos Antico
antiko.intro: Blaundos Antico travertine is a warm, beige-toned stone with antique character and subtle movement that suits both classic and contemporary designs. Sourced directly from our Uşak–Ulubey region, Majen supplies wholesale slabs with consistent grading, reliable lead times, and reinforced packaging for export. Architects, importers, and contractors choose this variety for durable floors, façades, countertops, and bespoke interior features, achieving timeless elegance with dependable performance across residential and commercial projects.
antiko.alt: Wholesale Blaundos Antiko travertine slabs from Turkey
antiko.title2: Why Choose Blaundos Antico Travertine Slabs?
antiko.intro2: Blaundos Antico stands out for its earthy palette, nuanced veining, and antique texture that adds depth without overpowering a space. Its density and calibrated finishes support heavy-traffic areas while remaining easy to maintain. With quarry-direct sourcing, Majen controls selection and grading, ensuring predictable results at scale. Competitive pricing, flexible MOQs, and project-matched lots help streamline specifications. For large orders, we provide sample boards and detailed QC reports, enabling confident decisions for global builds.
description: Why choose Blaundos Antiko slabs: antique-inspired look, expressive veining, bookmatch options and strong continuity on large surfaces. Excellent balance of authenticity and durability for premium interiors.

Sourced and processed in Uşak–Ulubey. Used in island countertops, bathroom vanities, reception desks, wall cladding, elevator surrounds and luxury retail fixtures. Shade-verified lots for consistent project outcomes.

cards.text1: From luxury hospitality to private villas, Blaundos Antico adapts to varied aesthetics. Its neutral warmth pairs well with wood, metal, and glass, allowing cohesive palettes in mixed-material schemes. Designers value its ability to soften minimal interiors or enrich traditional settings with organic texture. Available finishes expand possibilities, from refined polished looks to tactile brushed or tumbled surfaces ideal for outdoor paths and pool surrounds. The result is a reliable, elegant stone that elevates spaces without visual noise.
cards.text2: Calibrated thickness, consistent flatness, and suitable surface treatments help Blaundos Antico perform in lobbies, corridors, and retail zones. Anti-slip options support safety outdoors, while proper sealing enhances stain resistance indoors. With accurate cutting and tight tolerances, installers achieve clean joints and level surfaces, reducing rework and time on site. This blend of aesthetics and practicality positions Blaundos Antico as a proven specification for demanding, design-driven environments across climates and usage patterns.

ApplicationSection.title: Applications of Blaundos Antico Travertine Slabs
ApplicationSection.text: Blaundos Antico is specified for floors, wall cladding, countertops, fireplace surrounds, stair treads, and exterior façades. Its antique texture lends character to boutique hotels and residences, while honed or polished finishes suit refined interiors. Outdoors, brushed or tumbled slabs complement landscaping, garden paths, and pool decks. The stone’s tonal stability supports continuity between inside and outside, helping designers create cohesive transitions. With accurate sizing and reliable supply, it scales from small renovations to flagship builds.
ApplicationSection.subtitle: Interior & Exterior Use Cases
ApplicationSection.subtext: Indoors, Blaundos Antico brings warmth to living areas and statement value to feature walls or reception desks. In kitchens and baths, sealed surfaces provide practical durability with natural beauty. Externally, its weathered look enriches patios and façades, aging gracefully over time. For public spaces, coordinated formats (slabs, tiles, custom pieces) keep design language consistent. Majen’s technical support advises on finish selection, slip ratings, and maintenance to match climate, footfall, and performance requirements.

AvailableSection.title: Available Sizes & Thickness
AvailableSection.text: Majen supplies slabs commonly at 2 cm and 3 cm thickness, cut from blocks selected for tone and structure. Custom dimensions can be produced on request, including book-matched sets for feature walls. Tight calibration and precision polishing ensure flatness and clean edges that speed installation. For special elements—vanities, stair treads, or oversized cladding—our team provides cut-to-size options that maintain vein continuity. Consistent sizing across batches supports predictable waste rates and accurate take-offs.
AvailableSection.subtitle: Dimensional Tolerances
AvailableSection.subtext: Slab thickness is controlled within industry tolerances to support even load distribution and dependable adhesion. Surface regularity reduces lippage risk on large floors, while square edges and stable geometry help installers achieve fine joints in visual-critical areas. For ventilated façades and lightweight assemblies, we coordinate with fabricators to meet bracket and anchor constraints. All dimensions are verified at dispatch, and reports are available for documentation and submittal packages when required.

FinishesSection.title: Finishes & Packaging Options
FinishesSection.text: Blaundos Antico can be supplied polished, honed, brushed, or tumbled to align with design intent and slip resistance needs. Finishes are applied with calibrated equipment to keep tone and sheen consistent across lots. For export, slabs are packed in reinforced wooden bundles with corner guards, interleaves, and strapping that limits movement in transit. Moisture-resistant wrapping and clear labeling aid handling at ports and job sites. Packaging is optimized for container loading to minimize risk and freight costs.
FinishesSection.subtitle: Surface Finish Guidance
FinishesSection.subtext: Select polished for premium interiors, honed for low-glare sophistication, brushed where texture is desired, and tumbled for rustic, outdoor-ready charm. In wet areas or exterior paths, combine texture with appropriate sealers to improve maintenance and slip performance. We can supply matched samples across finishes so teams preview appearance under project lighting. This process helps align expectations early, reducing change orders and helping stakeholders approve materials quickly and confidently.
FinishesSection.subtext2: Each bundle is photographed and measured prior to loading. Straps, braces, and internal blocking limit vibration, while protective interlayers reduce abrasion. Bundle IDs map to packing lists for fast checks at customs and on site. Shock indicators can be added on request. The goal is simple: slabs arrive installation-ready, with documentation that keeps receiving and quality verification efficient for importers and contractors.

PartnerSection.title: Why Partner with Majen for Travertine Slabs?
PartnerSection.description: Beyond quarry access, Majen offers technical guidance, flexible MOQs, and dependable lead times that fit real-world schedules. Direct sourcing keeps costs predictable and ensures tone matching across lots. Reinforced packaging, thorough documentation, and responsive support reduce friction during shipping and receiving. We build long-term relationships with importers, distributors, and contractors, providing post-delivery assistance and repeatable quality so projects finish on brief, on budget, and on time.
PartnerSection.text1: From sampling and mock-ups to installation advice, our team responds quickly with practical guidance. Multilingual communication, transparent timelines, and after-sales follow-up help keep stakeholders aligned. Whether you need book-matched features, custom cuts, or coordinated tiles, we manage details and share progress so decisions stay informed.
PartnerSection.text2: We prioritize responsible quarrying, water recycling, and waste reduction. Material traceability and documentation support green building goals and client ESG policies. These practices contribute to durable, long-life installations with lower lifecycle impact.
PartnerSection.text3: We provide packing data, certificates of origin, and HS codes; optional lab tests and slip ratings can be arranged. This documentation simplifies import processes and supports submittals for architects and contractors, helping approvals proceed without delays.

ExportSection.title: Travertine Slab Export Process
ExportSection.text: We coordinate the entire export cycle—from quarry selection and block cutting to finishing, inspection, and documentation. Orders include commercial invoice, packing list, and certificate of origin. With FOB and CIF terms available, our logistics team manages bookings, customs, and container optimization to protect material and timelines. Pre-shipment photos and QC summaries provide transparency. This streamlined process reduces administrative load for buyers and helps large projects maintain predictable schedules worldwide.

QualitySection.title: Quality Control & Grading of Slabs
QualitySection.text: Every Blaundos Antico slab is graded against criteria such as thickness accuracy, surface finish, color consistency, porosity, and structural soundness. We map natural features and exclude pieces that fall outside A-grade expectations for high-visibility applications. Moisture and adhesion checks support performance goals, while calibrated polishing ensures sheen uniformity. Clients can request detailed grading reports and photos to validate quality remotely. Only lots that meet specification proceed to packing and shipment.
QualitySection.subtitle: Inspection Criteria
QualitySection.subtext: Inspection verifies dimensions, flatness, edge quality, fill integrity, and finish continuity. Vein movement is evaluated for harmonious sequencing, especially for book-matched features. Any repairs are stabilized and re-finished to blend visually. Documentation captures measurements and observations so buyers can archive data for submittals and warranties. This disciplined process lowers on-site risk and supports consistent installation outcomes.

TextSection.text1: Explore complementary selections that pair well with Blaundos Antico. Each variety offers distinct tone and movement for different design intents, enabling cohesive palettes across floors, walls, and façades. Discover Blaundos Light Slabs for brighter schemes and Blaundos Ivory Slabs for creamy warmth. Coordinate with Travertine Tiles or Travertine Blocks to extend the language of natural stone through interiors, exteriors, and custom elements while keeping sourcing streamlined under one partner.
TextSection.text2: Ideal for kitchen islands, vanities and lobby walls. Pair with vein-cut bookmatch for dramatic continuity; specify 20–30 mm for interiors, 30+ mm for high-stress zones.
TextSection.text3: Reinforced A-frames, corner and moisture protection, photo-documented loading and shared seal numbers. FOB İzmir or CIF to major ports.

seo.title: Wholesale Travertine Tiles Blaundos Antico | Majen
seo.description: Rustic, elegant Blaundos Antico travertine tiles from Turkey. Quarry‑direct, A‑grade, export‑ready. Finishes, sizes, and global delivery by Majen.

antiko.title: Wholesale Travertine Tiles Blaundos Antico
antiko.intro: Blaundos Antico travertine tiles feature warm beige tones and an antique character that adds depth and authenticity to interior and exterior spaces. Sourced directly from our Uşak–Ulubey region, Majen supplies wholesale tiles graded for tone harmony and dimensional accuracy. Designers specify this variety for floors, walls, and feature surfaces where rustic elegance meets modern performance. Reinforced packaging, clear documentation, and reliable lead times make it project‑ready for global delivery.
antiko.alt: Wholesale Blaundos Antiko travertine slabs from Turkey
antiko.title2: Why Choose Blaundos Antico Travertine Tiles?
antiko.intro2: Blaundos Antico stands out with tactile textures and nuanced veining that create a timeless atmosphere. Its earthy palette pairs naturally with wood, metal, and plaster finishes. With quarry‑direct sourcing, Majen controls selection and grading across lots, ensuring consistent tone and surface quality. Flexible MOQs and competitive pricing support both boutique and multi‑phase programs. Samples and QC reports help teams approve materials quickly with confidence.
description: Why choose Blaundos Antiko slabs: antique-inspired look, expressive veining, bookmatch options and strong continuity on large surfaces. Excellent balance of authenticity and durability for premium interiors.

Sourced and processed in Uşak–Ulubey. Used in island countertops, bathroom vanities, reception desks, wall cladding, elevator surrounds and luxury retail fixtures. Shade-verified lots for consistent project outcomes.

cards.text1: From rustic villas to contemporary hospitality, these tiles balance character and calm. Use smaller formats for patterns (herringbone, French pattern) or large formats for clean, modern layouts. Available finishes expand possibilities—honed for subtle elegance, brushed or tumbled for texture and outdoor traction, polished for select statement zones where sheen is desired.
cards.text2: Calibrated thickness and stable geometry support tight joints and level surfaces in lobbies, corridors, and residential spaces. Proper sealing enhances stain resistance indoors; textured finishes improve slip confidence in wet areas and outdoors. Consistency across lots reduces on‑site adjustments and supports predictable schedules for contractors and installers.

ApplicationSection.title: Applications of Blaundos Antico Travertine Tiles
ApplicationSection.text: Ideal for floors, wall cladding, showers, kitchen splashes, fireplace surrounds, and outdoor terraces. The antique texture enriches boutique hotels and homes, while honed finishes suit refined interiors. Coordinated formats and trims enable visual continuity across rooms and from interior to exterior spaces, supporting cohesive design language throughout the project.'
ApplicationSection.subtitle: Interior & Exterior Use Cases
ApplicationSection.subtext: Indoors, honed tiles deliver soft matte refinement; in bathrooms and kitchens, sealers support maintenance. Outdoors, brushed or tumbled textures age gracefully and retain color clarity on paths and patios. With consistent tone and calibrated edges, installers achieve neat grout lines and predictable waste rates in both residential and commercial settings.

AvailableSection.title: Available Sizes & Thickness
AvailableSection.text: Common tile sizes include modular sets (French pattern), 30×60, 60×60, and larger formats where feasible. Standard thicknesses are around 10–12 mm, with other options upon request. Tiles are cut, calibrated, and chamfered as needed to support clean alignment and safe edges. Book‑matched features are available for special walls using coordinated slabs and tiles.
AvailableSection.subtitle: Dimensional Tolerances
AvailableSection.subtext: Thickness control, surface regularity, and square geometry reduce lippage risk and support reliable adhesion over large areas. For exterior installations, we coordinate with contractors on substrate prep, movement joints, and drainage. Measurements are verified before dispatch; dimensional reports can be provided for submittals and QA documentation when requested.

FinishesSection.title: Finishes & Packaging Options
FinishesSection.text: Choose honed for low‑glare sophistication, brushed or tumbled for tactile character and traction, and polished where sheen is desired indoors. Finishes are applied with calibrated equipment to keep tone and sheen consistent across lots. For export, tiles are packed in reinforced wooden crates with corner guards and moisture‑resistant wraps, optimized for container loading and long‑distance sea freight.
FinishesSection.subtitle: Surface Finish Guidance
FinishesSection.subtext: We guide finish selection by location, foot traffic, and maintenance goals. Multi‑finish sample sets help stakeholders preview appearance under project lighting, aligning expectations early and minimizing change orders.
FinishesSection.subtext2: Crates are measured and photographed prior to loading. Internal dividers and protective interlayers minimize vibration and abrasion. Crate IDs map to packing lists for fast checks at customs and on site; optional shock indicators are available on request.

PartnerSection.title: Why Partner with Majen for Travertine Tiles?
PartnerSection.description: Beyond quarry access, Majen offers technical guidance, flexible MOQs, and dependable lead times. Direct sourcing supports cost control and tone matching across lots. Reinforced packaging, thorough documentation, and responsive support reduce friction through shipping and receiving, helping projects finish on brief and on time.
PartnerSection.text1: Fast sampling, mock‑ups, and practical installation advice keep decisions informed. Multilingual communication and transparent timelines align stakeholders from specification to handover.
PartnerSection.text2: Responsible quarrying, water recycling, and waste reduction are prioritized. Traceability and documentation support green building goals and ESG policies.'
PartnerSection.text3: Packing data, certificates of origin, and HS codes are provided; optional lab tests and slip ratings can be arranged to simplify submittals and approvals.

ExportSection.title: Travertine Tile Export Process
ExportSection.text: Majen manages quarry selection, cutting, finishing, inspection, and documentation. Orders include commercial invoices, packing lists, and certificates of origin. Under FOB or CIF terms, logistics coordinates bookings, customs, and container optimization. Pre‑shipment photos and QC summaries add transparency for remote teams and keep programs on schedule.

QualitySection.title: Quality Control & Grading of Tiles
QualitySection.text: Tiles are graded for thickness accuracy, surface finish, tone consistency, porosity, and structural soundness. Natural features are mapped; pieces outside A‑grade expectations are removed from high‑visibility lots. Calibrated honing/brushing ensures uniform texture. Detailed grading reports and photos can be shared for remote validation prior to shipment.
QualitySection.subtitle: Inspection Criteria
QualitySection.subtext: Inspection verifies dimensions, flatness, edge quality, fill integrity, and finish continuity. Pattern compatibility and tone harmony are checked to support pleasing layouts. Documentation captures measurements and observations for submittals and warranties, lowering on‑site risk and supporting consistent installation outcomes.

TextSection.text1: Coordinate tiles with Blaundos Antico slabs for feature walls or counters. Explore Blaundos Light and Blaundos Ivory for brighter schemes. Pair with trims and thresholds to maintain continuity across rooms and between indoor and outdoor spaces.
TextSection.text2: Ideal for kitchen islands, vanities and lobby walls. Pair with vein-cut bookmatch for dramatic continuity; specify 20–30 mm for interiors, 30+ mm for high-stress zones.
TextSection.text3: Reinforced A-frames, corner and moisture protection, photo-documented loading and shared seal numbers. FOB İzmir or CIF to major ports.

items.q: Can Blaundos Antico tiles be used in wet areas?
items.a: Yes. Use brushed or tumbled textures and appropriate sealing for showers, entries, and pool surrounds.

items.q: What are common tile sizes and thicknesses?
items.a: Popular sizes include French pattern, 30×60 and 60×60; typical thickness is around 10–12 mm. Custom formats may be available on request.
Honed, brushed, tumbled, and polished (for select interiors). We help match finishes to traffic and maintenance requirements.
Yes. We ship under FOB or CIF terms with full documentation and logistics support.

items.q: How are tiles packaged for export?
items.a: In reinforced wooden crates with dividers, interlayers, corner guards, and moisture‑resistant wraps.

PartnerSection.text1: Rapid sampling, mock‑ups, and practical installation advice keep decisions informed. Multilingual communication and transparent timelines align stakeholders throughout the project lifecycle.
PartnerSection.text2: Responsible quarrying, water recycling, and waste reduction are prioritized. Traceability and documentation support ESG and green building goals.
PartnerSection.text3: Packing data, certificates of origin, and HS codes are provided; optional lab tests and slip ratings can be arranged to simplify submittals and approvals.

ExportSection.title: Travertine Tile Export Process
ExportSection.text: Majen manages quarry selection, cutting, finishing, inspection, and documentation. Orders include commercial invoices, packing lists, and certificates of origin. Under FOB or CIF terms, logistics coordinates bookings, customs, and container optimization. Pre‑shipment QC photos provide transparency for remote teams.'

QualitySection.title: Quality Control & Grading of Tiles
QualitySection.text: Tiles are graded for thickness accuracy, finish uniformity, tone consistency, and structural soundness. Natural features are mapped; pieces outside A‑grade expectations are removed from premium lots. Calibrated finishing ensures visual continuity. Grading reports and photos can be shared for remote validation.'
QualitySection.subtitle: Inspection Criteria
QualitySection.subtext: Inspection verifies dimensions, flatness, edge quality, fill integrity, and tone harmony. Pattern alignment and finish continuity are checked to support seamless installation. Documentation captures measurements for submittals and warranties.

TextSection.text1: Coordinate Blaundos Ivory tiles with slabs for feature walls or counters. Explore Blaundos Light for brighter schemes or Blaundos Antico for rustic warmth. Use trims and thresholds to maintain continuity across rooms and indoor–outdoor transitions.

items.q: Are Blaundos Ivory tiles suitable for outdoor use?
items.a: Yes. Brushed or tumbled finishes with sealing are recommended for terraces, pool surrounds, and paths.

items.q: What sizes and thicknesses are available?
items.a: Common sizes include 30×60, 60×60, and modular French patterns; typical thickness is 10–12 mm. Customs may be available on request.
Honed, brushed, tumbled, and polished (for interiors). Finish selection depends on usage and maintenance goals.
Yes. We export under FOB or CIF terms with full documentation and logistics support.
In reinforced wooden crates with dividers, corner guards, and moisture‑resistant wrapping.'

special.title: Wholesale Travertine Special Designs
special.intro: Majen designs and manufactures Custom Travertine Designs, including steps, stair treads, risers, pool copings, mosaics, borders, thresholds, sills, columns, and other cut-to-size pieces. Produced in Blaundos Antiko, Light, and Ivory, each item is crafted to project specs with CNC profiling and edge detailing. Reinforced crates and clear labelling make installation faster on site. Importers rely on Majen for Custom Travertine Designs with consistent quality and FOB/CIF export options.
special.title2: Why Choose Wholesale Travertine Special Designs ?
special.intro2: Custom Travertine Designs offer unique value for villas, hotels, retail and public spaces where standard tiles or slabs are not enough. Majen’s quarry-direct supply, certified inspections and CAD-to-production workflow reduce errors and lead times. Our team collaborates with architects and contractors to match finishes, edges and radiuses across the project, ensuring design consistency and predictable outcomes at scale.
description: Majen is a trusted supplier of Wholesale Travertine Special Designs, offering steps, mosaics, borders, and unique architectural elements crafted from Blaundos travertine. Our designs combine durability with timeless aesthetics and are reinforced for secure international shipments.

Special travertine pieces are ideal for staircases, poolsides, hotel lobbies, villas, and custom architectural projects. Blaundos Antiko, Light, and Ivory provide versatile tones, enabling designers and importers to meet diverse creative needs.

Travertine special designs are available in thicknesses from 2–5 cm, with custom dimensions available on request. Every bespoke piece is cut and finished with precision to ensure accuracy, stability, and consistency across large projects.

Custom designs are available in polished, honed, brushed, and tumbled finishes. For export, each item is carefully packed in reinforced wooden crates with nylon wrapping and metal strapping, ensuring safe container loading and delivery worldwide.

variants.heading: Travertine Special Desing Varieties
variants.text: Majen offers three primary types of Wholesale Travertine Special Designs: Blaundos Antiko, Blaundos Light, and Blaundos Ivory. Each variety is crafted with precision at our Uşak–Ulubey quarry, ensuring durability, consistent texture, and aesthetic value. Export-ready and reinforced for sea freight, these bespoke travertine designs are trusted by architects, importers, and wholesalers worldwide.

TextSection.text1: Majen manages the Travertine Special Design Export Process from precise quarry cutting to container loading. Each piece is documented with invoices, packing lists, and certificates of origin, then secured in reinforced wooden crates for sea freight. With FOB and CIF terms, importers benefit from a transparent, safe, and reliable supply chain, ensuring stair steps, mosaics, borders, and decorative elements arrive on time.
TextSection.header2: Quality Control & Grading of Special Designs
TextSection.text2: Quality Control & Grading of Special Designs includes inspections of thickness tolerance, surface finish, edge stability, and color consistency. Only A-grade pieces pass final checks and are packed in protective crates to reduce breakage risks. This process minimizes waste on-site and ensures architects and contractors receive reliable products for villas, hotels, and signature projects.
TextSection.header3: Global Markets & Applications for Special Designs
TextSection.text3: Global Markets & Applications for Special Designs include high-end residential, hospitality, and commercial projects across Europe, the USA, and the Middle East. Travertine steps, pool surrounds, mosaics, and façade elements in Blaundos Antiko, Light, and Ivory are used to enhance both interior and exterior spaces. Consistent production and reinforced packing guarantee secure supply for large-scale shipments.
TextSection.header4: Why Partner with Majen for Travertine Special Designs?
TextSection.text4: Why Partner with Majen for Travertine Special Designs? Because Majen is more than a quarry — we are an experienced export partner. Direct sourcing from Uşak–Ulubey ensures stable production, competitive pricing, and flexible custom options. With reinforced packaging, complete documentation, and long-term client relationships, Majen is trusted worldwide for bespoke travertine elements.
TextSection.subtext1: Average block size is 280×220×200 cm with natural surfaces. Export-ready, suitable for bulk orders, with reinforced packaging for container loading.
TextSection.subtext2: Countertops, wall cladding, flooring, and exterior façades where durability and natural elegance are required.
TextSection.subtext3: Polished, honed, tumbled, and brushed surfaces to match diverse design requirements and performance needs.
TextSection.subtext4: Custom designs elevate aesthetics and provide exclusive solutions while preserving travertine’s natural durability and texture.

QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq1_header: What types of travertine special designs are available?
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq1_text: Steps, mosaics, borders, columns, and bespoke architectural elements crafted from Blaundos travertine.
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq2_header: Do you export special designs worldwide?
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq2_text: Yes. Majen exports Wholesale Travertine Special Designs globally with FOB and CIF terms.
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq3_header: How are custom travertine pieces packaged for shipping?
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq3_text: All designs are packed in reinforced wooden crates, strapped and wrapped to ensure safe transport.

cuts.heading: Travertine Special Design Cut Options
cuts.text: Choose honed for subtle refinement, brushed or tumbled for traction and texture, and polished for high-end interiors.

vein-cut.title: Vein Cut Travertine Special Design
vein-cut.intro: Vein-cut blocks reveal linear banding for strong directionality in design.
vein-cut.intro2: Parallel bands create visual continuity across large surfaces.
vein-cut.description: Large-size special design selected at the quarry with consistent character.

TextSection.text2: Hotel lobbies, wall cladding and long corridors where continuity is desired.

QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq2_header: Are there direction rules for fabrication?
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq2_text: Keep band orientation consistent across adjacent pieces for best results.

antiko.title: Wholesale Travertine Special Design Blaundos Antico
antiko.intro: Blaundos Antico travertine is a warm, beige-toned stone with antique character and subtle movement that suits both classic and contemporary designs. Sourced directly from our Uşak–Ulubey region, Majen supplies wholesale slabs with consistent grading, reliable lead times, and reinforced packaging for export. Architects, importers, and contractors choose this variety for durable floors, façades, countertops, and bespoke interior features, achieving timeless elegance with dependable performance across residential and commercial projects.
antiko.alt: Wholesale Blaundos Antiko travertine slabs from Turkey
antiko.title2: Why Choose Blaundos Antico Travertine Slabs?
antiko.intro2: Blaundos Antico stands out for its earthy palette, nuanced veining, and antique texture that adds depth without overpowering a space. Its density and calibrated finishes support heavy-traffic areas while remaining easy to maintain. With quarry-direct sourcing, Majen controls selection and grading, ensuring predictable results at scale. Competitive pricing, flexible MOQs, and project-matched lots help streamline specifications. For large orders, we provide sample boards and detailed QC reports, enabling confident decisions for global builds.
description: Why choose Blaundos Antiko slabs: antique-inspired look, expressive veining, bookmatch options and strong continuity on large surfaces. Excellent balance of authenticity and durability for premium interiors.

Sourced and processed in Uşak–Ulubey. Used in island countertops, bathroom vanities, reception desks, wall cladding, elevator surrounds and luxury retail fixtures. Shade-verified lots for consistent project outcomes.

cards.text1: From luxury hospitality to private villas, Blaundos Antico adapts to varied aesthetics. Its neutral warmth pairs well with wood, metal, and glass, allowing cohesive palettes in mixed-material schemes. Designers value its ability to soften minimal interiors or enrich traditional settings with organic texture. Available finishes expand possibilities, from refined polished looks to tactile brushed or tumbled surfaces ideal for outdoor paths and pool surrounds. The result is a reliable, elegant stone that elevates spaces without visual noise.
cards.text2: Calibrated thickness, consistent flatness, and suitable surface treatments help Blaundos Antico perform in lobbies, corridors, and retail zones. Anti-slip options support safety outdoors, while proper sealing enhances stain resistance indoors. With accurate cutting and tight tolerances, installers achieve clean joints and level surfaces, reducing rework and time on site. This blend of aesthetics and practicality positions Blaundos Antico as a proven specification for demanding, design-driven environments across climates and usage patterns.

ApplicationSection.title: Applications of Blaundos Antico Travertine Slabs
ApplicationSection.text: Blaundos Antico is specified for floors, wall cladding, countertops, fireplace surrounds, stair treads, and exterior façades. Its antique texture lends character to boutique hotels and residences, while honed or polished finishes suit refined interiors. Outdoors, brushed or tumbled slabs complement landscaping, garden paths, and pool decks. The stone’s tonal stability supports continuity between inside and outside, helping designers create cohesive transitions. With accurate sizing and reliable supply, it scales from small renovations to flagship builds.
ApplicationSection.subtitle: Interior & Exterior Use Cases
ApplicationSection.subtext: Indoors, Blaundos Antico brings warmth to living areas and statement value to feature walls or reception desks. In kitchens and baths, sealed surfaces provide practical durability with natural beauty. Externally, its weathered look enriches patios and façades, aging gracefully over time. For public spaces, coordinated formats (slabs, tiles, custom pieces) keep design language consistent. Majen’s technical support advises on finish selection, slip ratings, and maintenance to match climate, footfall, and performance requirements.

AvailableSection.title: Available Sizes & Thickness
AvailableSection.text: Majen supplies slabs commonly at 2 cm and 3 cm thickness, cut from blocks selected for tone and structure. Custom dimensions can be produced on request, including book-matched sets for feature walls. Tight calibration and precision polishing ensure flatness and clean edges that speed installation. For special elements—vanities, stair treads, or oversized cladding—our team provides cut-to-size options that maintain vein continuity. Consistent sizing across batches supports predictable waste rates and accurate take-offs.
AvailableSection.subtitle: Dimensional Tolerances
AvailableSection.subtext: Slab thickness is controlled within industry tolerances to support even load distribution and dependable adhesion. Surface regularity reduces lippage risk on large floors, while square edges and stable geometry help installers achieve fine joints in visual-critical areas. For ventilated façades and lightweight assemblies, we coordinate with fabricators to meet bracket and anchor constraints. All dimensions are verified at dispatch, and reports are available for documentation and submittal packages when required.

FinishesSection.title: Finishes & Packaging Options
FinishesSection.text: Blaundos Antico can be supplied polished, honed, brushed, or tumbled to align with design intent and slip resistance needs. Finishes are applied with calibrated equipment to keep tone and sheen consistent across lots. For export, slabs are packed in reinforced wooden bundles with corner guards, interleaves, and strapping that limits movement in transit. Moisture-resistant wrapping and clear labeling aid handling at ports and job sites. Packaging is optimized for container loading to minimize risk and freight costs.
FinishesSection.subtitle: Surface Finish Guidance
FinishesSection.subtext: Select polished for premium interiors, honed for low-glare sophistication, brushed where texture is desired, and tumbled for rustic, outdoor-ready charm. In wet areas or exterior paths, combine texture with appropriate sealers to improve maintenance and slip performance. We can supply matched samples across finishes so teams preview appearance under project lighting. This process helps align expectations early, reducing change orders and helping stakeholders approve materials quickly and confidently.
FinishesSection.subtext2: Each bundle is photographed and measured prior to loading. Straps, braces, and internal blocking limit vibration, while protective interlayers reduce abrasion. Bundle IDs map to packing lists for fast checks at customs and on site. Shock indicators can be added on request. The goal is simple: slabs arrive installation-ready, with documentation that keeps receiving and quality verification efficient for importers and contractors.

PartnerSection.title: Why Partner with Majen for Travertine Slabs?
PartnerSection.description: Beyond quarry access, Majen offers technical guidance, flexible MOQs, and dependable lead times that fit real-world schedules. Direct sourcing keeps costs predictable and ensures tone matching across lots. Reinforced packaging, thorough documentation, and responsive support reduce friction during shipping and receiving. We build long-term relationships with importers, distributors, and contractors, providing post-delivery assistance and repeatable quality so projects finish on brief, on budget, and on time.
PartnerSection.text1: From sampling and mock-ups to installation advice, our team responds quickly with practical guidance. Multilingual communication, transparent timelines, and after-sales follow-up help keep stakeholders aligned. Whether you need book-matched features, custom cuts, or coordinated tiles, we manage details and share progress so decisions stay informed.
PartnerSection.text2: We prioritize responsible quarrying, water recycling, and waste reduction. Material traceability and documentation support green building goals and client ESG policies. These practices contribute to durable, long-life installations with lower lifecycle impact.
PartnerSection.text3: We provide packing data, certificates of origin, and HS codes; optional lab tests and slip ratings can be arranged. This documentation simplifies import processes and supports submittals for architects and contractors, helping approvals proceed without delays.

TextSection.text1: Explore complementary selections that pair well with Blaundos Antico. Each variety offers distinct tone and movement for different design intents, enabling cohesive palettes across floors, walls, and façades. Discover Blaundos Light Slabs for brighter schemes and Blaundos Ivory Slabs for creamy warmth. Coordinate with Travertine Tiles or Travertine Blocks to extend the language of natural stone through interiors, exteriors, and custom elements while keeping sourcing streamlined under one partner.
TextSection.text2: Ideal for kitchen islands, vanities and lobby walls. Pair with vein-cut bookmatch for dramatic continuity; specify 20–30 mm for interiors, 30+ mm for high-stress zones.
TextSection.text3: Reinforced A-frames, corner and moisture protection, photo-documented loading and shared seal numbers. FOB İzmir or CIF to major ports.

items.a: Its antique texture, warm beige tones, and subtle veining create sophisticated, timeless surfaces suited to both classic and modern designs.
Yes. Brushed or tumbled finishes with proper sealing are recommended for paths, pool decks, and façades.

Typically 2 cm and 3 cm; custom sizes and book-matched sets are available on request.

items.a: In reinforced wooden bundles with interleaves, corner guards, strapping, and moisture-resistant wrapping.
Yes. We ship under FOB or CIF terms with full documentation and logistics support.

AvailableSection.text: Majen supplies slabs commonly at 2 cm and 3 cm thickness, cut from blocks selected for tone and structure. Custom dimensions can be produced on request, including book-matched sets for feature walls. Tight calibration and precision polishing ensure flatness and clean edges that speed installation. For special elements—vanities, stair treads, or oversized cladding—our team provides cut-to-size options that maintain vein continuity. Consistent sizing across batches supports predictable waste rates and accurate take-offs.
AvailableSection.subtitle: Dimensional Tolerances
AvailableSection.subtext: Slab thickness is controlled within industry tolerances to support even load distribution and dependable adhesion. Surface regularity reduces lippage risk on large floors, while square edges and stable geometry help installers achieve fine joints in visual-critical areas. For ventilated façades and lightweight assemblies, we coordinate with fabricators to meet bracket and anchor constraints. All dimensions are verified at dispatch, and reports are available for documentation and submittal packages when required.

FinishesSection.title: Finishes & Packaging Options
FinishesSection.text: Blaundos Antico can be supplied polished, honed, brushed, or tumbled to align with design intent and slip resistance needs. Finishes are applied with calibrated equipment to keep tone and sheen consistent across lots. For export, slabs are packed in reinforced wooden bundles with corner guards, interleaves, and strapping that limits movement in transit. Moisture-resistant wrapping and clear labeling aid handling at ports and job sites. Packaging is optimized for container loading to minimize risk and freight costs.
FinishesSection.subtitle: Surface Finish Guidance
FinishesSection.subtext: Select polished for premium interiors, honed for low-glare sophistication, brushed where texture is desired, and tumbled for rustic, outdoor-ready charm. In wet areas or exterior paths, combine texture with appropriate sealers to improve maintenance and slip performance. We can supply matched samples across finishes so teams preview appearance under project lighting. This process helps align expectations early, reducing change orders and helping stakeholders approve materials quickly and confidently.
FinishesSection.subtext2: Each bundle is photographed and measured prior to loading. Straps, braces, and internal blocking limit vibration, while protective interlayers reduce abrasion. Bundle IDs map to packing lists for fast checks at customs and on site. Shock indicators can be added on request. The goal is simple: slabs arrive installation-ready, with documentation that keeps receiving and quality verification efficient for importers and contractors.

PartnerSection.title: Why Partner with Majen for Travertine Slabs?
PartnerSection.description: Beyond quarry access, Majen offers technical guidance, flexible MOQs, and dependable lead times that fit real-world schedules. Direct sourcing keeps costs predictable and ensures tone matching across lots. Reinforced packaging, thorough documentation, and responsive support reduce friction during shipping and receiving. We build long-term relationships with importers, distributors, and contractors, providing post-delivery assistance and repeatable quality so projects finish on brief, on budget, and on time.
PartnerSection.text1: From sampling and mock-ups to installation advice, our team responds quickly with practical guidance. Multilingual communication, transparent timelines, and after-sales follow-up help keep stakeholders aligned. Whether you need book-matched features, custom cuts, or coordinated tiles, we manage details and share progress so decisions stay informed.
PartnerSection.text2: We prioritize responsible quarrying, water recycling, and waste reduction. Material traceability and documentation support green building goals and client ESG policies. These practices contribute to durable, long-life installations with lower lifecycle impact.
PartnerSection.text3: We provide packing data, certificates of origin, and HS codes; optional lab tests and slip ratings can be arranged. This documentation simplifies import processes and supports submittals for architects and contractors, helping approvals proceed without delays.

cards.text1: From luxury hospitality to private villas, Blaundos Antico adapts to varied aesthetics. Its neutral warmth pairs well with wood, metal, and glass, allowing cohesive palettes in mixed-material schemes. Designers value its ability to soften minimal interiors or enrich traditional settings with organic texture. Available finishes expand possibilities, from refined polished looks to tactile brushed or tumbled surfaces ideal for outdoor paths and pool surrounds. The result is a reliable, elegant stone that elevates spaces without visual noise.
cards.text2: Calibrated thickness, consistent flatness, and suitable surface treatments help Blaundos Antico perform in lobbies, corridors, and retail zones. Anti-slip options support safety outdoors, while proper sealing enhances stain resistance indoors. With accurate cutting and tight tolerances, installers achieve clean joints and level surfaces, reducing rework and time on site. This blend of aesthetics and practicality positions Blaundos Antico as a proven specification for demanding, design-driven environments across climates and usage patterns.

ApplicationSection.title: Applications of Blaundos Antico Travertine Slabs
ApplicationSection.text: Blaundos Antico is specified for floors, wall cladding, countertops, fireplace surrounds, stair treads, and exterior façades. Its antique texture lends character to boutique hotels and residences, while honed or polished finishes suit refined interiors. Outdoors, brushed or tumbled slabs complement landscaping, garden paths, and pool decks. The stone’s tonal stability supports continuity between inside and outside, helping designers create cohesive transitions. With accurate sizing and reliable supply, it scales from small renovations to flagship builds.
ApplicationSection.subtitle: Interior & Exterior Use Cases
ApplicationSection.subtext: Indoors, Blaundos Antico brings warmth to living areas and statement value to feature walls or reception desks. In kitchens and baths, sealed surfaces provide practical durability with natural beauty. Externally, its weathered look enriches patios and façades, aging gracefully over time. For public spaces, coordinated formats (slabs, tiles, custom pieces) keep design language consistent. Majen’s technical support advises on finish selection, slip ratings, and maintenance to match climate, footfall, and performance requirements.

BlaundosIntro.title: In the Footsteps of Blaundos
BlaundosIntro.paragraph: We draw inspiration from the time-worn stones of the ancient city of Blaundos. With rich veining and natural tonal shifts, marble (travertine) brings timeless elegance to contemporary design, adding historical depth and lasting beauty to every space.
